reviews.text: Incredible concierge staff

This association is know to be a scam , they have recently gotten rid of first residential company that oversees  all residential services such as parking, recieving mail etc, they didnt even give notice to the employees nor did they have a meeting with them about concerns , they made promises about positions and raises and to top things off they had the former business train thete replacements without them even knowing, they had a meeting on valentines day evening and fired everyone the next day without notice , hard working citizens who have been with them 5, 10, 15 years.....

We were looking at condos here until we started talking about the association and the association fees here. I just don't get a good feeling about the homeowners association here. The concrete is crumbling and we can't get a straight answer from anybody about why. We will not be buying a condo here
High living in Buckhead

Always good to come back here. Today is the first time I’ve been here since they have opened the new tap room. They are now able to offer 24 beers on tap from the brewery, hatchery and woodlands selections. Their menu looks amazing and can not wait to try it! Would recommend getting a sampler of a few beers and finding what you like! Cheers

Visiting from the Richmond VA area that is loaded with craft breweries, this was a very cool spot to hang out and have a few beers on a Sunday afternoon. We had just had brunch so we didn't get any food, but there was a wide variety of beers to try so everyone should be able to find something they like. The vibe of the place was very laid back and the bartenders were friendly. A little off the main drag but worth a visit if you're a craft beer fan.

Okay first and foremost, I have loved every drink made for me! The people that are working are helpful and very fast. I'll continue to go back. Also, is there anyway dragon milk tea can be on the menu. I know someone there knows how to make it and it's my favorite drink ha. I reccomend this place over any Starbucks!

Came from out of town and wanted to visit this brewery since I enjoy their beers. Drove an hour through traffic only to be turned away for a private event. They could at least advertised on Google that they were closed. They should have a designated area open to the public even if they host private events. Fail.

SweetWater brings people together. The place has been renovated within the last year (at the time of writing this) and the main tasting room is very different than the old one. It is much more spacious, and has televisions surrounding it. My one complaint with the current tasting room is that there seems to be too much space. Even on the busiest nights, there aren't many places to sit, just a bunch of open standing room. This is a small quarrel with an otherwise outstanding brewery experience. I highly recommend trying the G13 420 Strain. It's currently the best beer they serve. If the hemp flavor is not really your thing, then the classic 420 Pale Ale is also a great choice. Bringing a larger group is also a good idea, as there is room for indoor cornhole which is always a good time. Overall, the beer is great and the people are very welcoming. SweetWater is always a fantastic start to the weekend.

This is what you should call a "finer diner". It looks glitz on the outside and inside is classic early 20th century. I had a chef special, veal meatballs and spaghetti with a glass of cool wine. Exactly what I needed. Friendly service and an obvious family favourite. A bit out of the centre, but my recommend for anyone visiting Atlanta.

A local took me (an out-of-town visitor) here, and what a great choice it was! The menu had great variety, from comfort food to unique cuisine. Delicious main course and dessert. Service was superb. Prices push the envelope, but not obscenely so. Look at my other reviews to see that I don't easily impress like this.

$$+ Typical Buckhead pricing for eats. What was neither typical nor anticipated was the high quality food, the exemplary service of the waitstaff and the atmosphere inside.  So, if you are thinking diner when you see the place as your driving around, don't let that stop you from enjoying one of Buckhead's finest eating establishments. I'd have given them 5 stars if but for the whole forced valet parking thing. COVERED parking, yes, in your own parking lot, no.

PLEASE LIKE my review if it has been helpful to you.
Thanks!

We came in on a Sunday night and it wasn’t very busy. The valet, the hostess and our server were welcoming and friendly. The service was excellent and we had very little wait time before our order came. I was a bit disappointed with the food. Our blue cheese chips were not what I remembered them to be (what happened to the sweet potato chips?!). The blue cheese and sauce were tasty but the chips were stale and not freshly made for the order. The Sunday chicken dinner was small. The cole slaw was literally 3 small bites. The 3 pieces of chicken, breast thigh and leg were well seasoned and fried nicely but the smallest pieces I’ve ever seen. The chicken breast was boneless and I’m guessing it had been cut in half, the creamy mac and cheese was fine but I would not order this dish again. I would have normally given a rating of 2 stars but gave 3 stars because of the excellent service. Maybe it was just an off night.
Surprised in what you get in a diner.  The decor is amazing.  A bit pricey.  Professional staff.  The flat chicken salad dish was so tastey!

The ambiance is sophisticated and festive. The servers are professional and knowledgeable, attentive without hovering. The food is incredible. I haven't eaten here for a few years, so I was delighted to find new dishes on the menu. My meal was perfectly seasoned and plated. I will eat here again!

Very romantic place for a random husband and wife date night. Our server was very knowledgeable and on top of his game. The food was amazing, we had an absolutely lovely time! Would def go back again to this location.

This restaurant greets you as an old friend.  Friendly, happy to answer any questions and polite.  Amanda was our waitress.  She was just perfect.  She anticipated our needs and was very attentive.   The food is out of this world.  From the stuffed mushrooms to the filet with caramelized scallops, the dining experience is the best. We will be back every time we visit our children.

To

Just enjoyed a wonderful meal with my girlfriend for a late valentines dinner. Our server Antonio had excellent recommendations for whiskey and food! Great place to go for a nice meal without totally breaking the bank! Thanks Antonio!

PHENOMENAL!!!

Scallops were incredible. Highly recommend! Request Matthew as your server, best service I have received in a long time.

The service is exceptionally better. The steaks were good. I would expect out of a fine dining restaurant. The wait staff was very stiff & not personable. Overall I have enjoyed the food and will visit again.

Fantastic Atlanta steakhouse. My filet was cooked perfectly (rare)! The sides were very generous portions. The asparagus was huge, but really tender (how do they do that?). Not sure how, but we also split a dessert ice cream cake.  Really outstanding.

Bones is always a favorite. The cork fee for bringing your own wine is very fair. The food, is ridiculously great. The hash brown with sour cream on top is just that, over the top. Steaks are incredible and the famous lobster bisk has been served for 40 years with the exact same recipe. You better try it. Have had the pleasure of dining here several times, and it’s always a wonderful experience.

We just celebrated my birthday tonight and our experience was wonderful. From the moment we walked in we were seated promptly. The food was phenomenal even my mom said she will give this restaurant a 5 star rating. We loved our waiter he was very patient and knowledgeable about the menu. My husband who loves steak said his was phenomenal! I especially loved my Birthday cake slice. We will definitely be back.

My daughter took me there for my birthday and I had a wonderful time. I will never forget how elegant and how wonderful my experience was. The waiter and the host when we came in was excellent, the food was delightful and the surprise of the table decorated for my birthday and the Beautiful birthday ice cream cake that.. Oh my God I had the most wonderful birthday I have ever had. Thank you for the experience. I will be back.

We came here for restaurant week. The food was really good, although we were served slightly different food than was what on the menu (we got brussel sprouts instead of zucchini, for example). The service was incredibly slow, but also for no apparent reason. They weren't super busy or anything. Overall, I'd still come back. The food was all delicious and our server was friendly

Go to Savoy Taproom for good times at great establishment. You can really tell you're at local place that stands out from generic bars and restaurants. What brings me back is well executed food, drinks that vary from a good pint of brew to unique cocktails, and local original music.

LOVE THIS PLACE!! Mostly on the first Sundays of the month when they have a mimosa bar. The mimosas are great, the prices are not too bad to be honest, and their breakfast items are BOMB! I recommend the Farmers breakfast.
We had a great brunch! The mimosa bar was fun and my French toast was great. Prices were reasonable. Everyone had great meals. We will definitely be back!

Really busy on weekends making it hard to get seating and a drink at/around the bar in such a small place.. come early and/or plan ahead. Great cozy vibe and excellent spirits and cocktail menu that changes seasonally. Your drink will be made well and presented in a beautiful fashion!
Delicious.  We tried about 8 different sushi rolls and the family style fried rice.  Very very good food! Friendly service also.

Ordering the omakase was the best decision!  The 6 course chef's choice tasting menu a big win for my spouse's birthday! I do recommend folks confirm your budget ahead of time as I did...this is high quality food and service.
Nice, quiet, cozy spot. Sushi was affordable and tasty. Good dumplings. If I lived closer I would be a regular.

This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants. I have been eating here for over 15 years. I found this quaint restaurant on Pharr Rd and followed them to Roswell Rd. I spend every birthday at Taka and usually eat here at least once a month.
Great sushi and interesting new Japanese beers

It was a great experience to visit the park. We went in the morning and it was cool breeze there. There were people of all the ages who where running/jogging that they. Everybody was so excited and happy. May be because of the place and environment. It has a good water fountain where you can stand in the middle and take pictures. Avoid drenching yourself while trying to get in the middle and getting out of it. Walkway inside is laid down with bricks with people’s names on it. It was a wonder feeling

Nice small park in the heart of downtown Atlanta. It's a mix of green areas and concrete and I would have honestly expected way more from a place that celebrates such an important historical event. Nothing special in itself, but it serves the purpose of a nice area where to chill out during lunch time if you work in the area

This park is massive, very beautiful, has a water fountain with synchronized music playing out of the speakers anchored on poles  some times,  a child's play area, some sitting, eatery, variety of flowers and trees, lots of green grass space.

 I don't know much about the names on floor bricks as i spent limited time here but ensure to find more about the history of the park if you can. 

It is frequently used for events and as a relaxation spot and  don't forget to take good pictures of your self here.

A really beautiful park. The fountain has a show where the put a song and the water starts dancing to the song, its really fun. There are a lot of statues, beutiful trees and monuments. Almost all of the touristic attractions in Atlanta are in or really near this Park, including the World of Coca Cola, the Georgia Aquarium, the human rights museum, the CNN building and more. Its really beautiful and you can't come to Atlanta without seeing this park. I almost forgot the most important part, it is for free

Looking for a great place to accommodate every age range? Centennial Park is it! From the water spouts, to the playground or even the picturesque pools and walking trail this park has a lot to offer. Located in the very heart of Atlanta you can literally take the pulse of the city from this spot! No matter how many people  are out it's hard to feel crowded here with such a large venue.

I went for a birthday dinner and we had a good time. It's a pretty decent sized placed that is split between a club area and a dining area. There is a dress code that is enforced after 10 and there is free street parking or valet parking.

The food is actually pretty good and generous size portions. I went with the half a rotisserie chicken and I was definitely full after eating only half of my meal. 

If you are a picky eater this isn't the pace for you. They are shooting for an upscale vibe and their menu items have little tweaks to the norm. For instance they have "honey" lemon pepper wings which are lemon pepper wings drizzled with honey. The steak also has a type of sauce that I really wasn't feeling but the steak was cooked well.

The drinks are pretty good and even my wife had a couple. You will spend money here so just be careful. I think the average drink was about $12 and not really a decent sized drink.

Valet parking is $20 or $10. $10 has a two hour window. 

I would go back and I would recommend you trying it out. It's in an interesting area to where I would rather park in valet than park on the street.

This is a first time at lounge, which is spacious. The atmosphere is diverse and resembles a sports bar with multiple television. Key differences are live band and live comedy. The servers are incredible.  There is an additional charge to hear the comedy show-entertainment fee.  There is valet parking for $10.  This is a great space for events.

Great dining EVERY time. The food is consistently good and I ALWAYS receive fantastic service. Shout out to the management for maintaining the standard at Suite Food Lounge. I'm DEFINITELY coming back and going to send my family and friends your way!
This place is wonderful. The food really surprised me and my wife - dishes were delicious. The service is top notch. Good atmosphere and location. Give them a try.
I celebrated my 53 birthday there. Great place and the drinks are worth every dime. The food was finger licking good. Staff was everything. SMILING

It was a great experience to visit the park. We went in the morning and it was cool breeze there. There were people of all the ages who where running/jogging that they. Everybody was so excited and happy. May be because of the place and environment. It has a good water fountain where you can stand in the middle and take pictures. Avoid drenching yourself while trying to get in the middle and getting out of it. Walkway inside is laid down with bricks with people’s names on it. It was a wonder feeling

Nice small park in the heart of downtown Atlanta. It's a mix of green areas and concrete and I would have honestly expected way more from a place that celebrates such an important historical event. Nothing special in itself, but it serves the purpose of a nice area where to chill out during lunch time if you work in the area

This park is massive, very beautiful, has a water fountain with synchronized music playing out of the speakers anchored on poles  some times,  a child's play area, some sitting, eatery, variety of flowers and trees, lots of green grass space.

 I don't know much about the names on floor bricks as i spent limited time here but ensure to find more about the history of the park if you can. 

It is frequently used for events and as a relaxation spot and  don't forget to take good pictures of your self here.

A really beautiful park. The fountain has a show where the put a song and the water starts dancing to the song, its really fun. There are a lot of statues, beutiful trees and monuments. Almost all of the touristic attractions in Atlanta are in or really near this Park, including the World of Coca Cola, the Georgia Aquarium, the human rights museum, the CNN building and more. Its really beautiful and you can't come to Atlanta without seeing this park. I almost forgot the most important part, it is for free

Looking for a great place to accommodate every age range? Centennial Park is it! From the water spouts, to the playground or even the picturesque pools and walking trail this park has a lot to offer. Located in the very heart of Atlanta you can literally take the pulse of the city from this spot! No matter how many people  are out it's hard to feel crowded here with such a large venue.

I attended a convention last March within Omni Hotel and decided to try this restaurant.  I booked a table for one but still had to wait for a while.  Once inside, the server was in a hurry apparently.  As soon as they brought my order, they dropped the bill on my table...and I felt like ordering something else.  I was surprised to see how rude a waiter in a 'fancy' place can be.  Did not enjoy my meal either. I walked away with a stomachache.

Edible food, but significantly overpriced. Service was almost insulting, and certainly disappointing. If not in a rush or trapped by a zombie apocalypse at the Omni hotel, find other options. Do not order via room service.

Gabriel was the best server ever! He was accommodating and so interested in our trip to Atlanta. Extremely friendly and gave great recommendations. Loved having him as a server two nights into a row and can’t wait to come back.
The breakfast buffet was incredible. Made-to-order omelettes, fresh fruit, and delicious pastries. Ashley, our dining room attendant, was excellent. She made our breakfast enjoyable.

I stayed at the Omni Hotel and ordered 3 different meals from the various sections of the hotel including room service, Latitude’s Bar and the Restaurant. Each meal was over priced and below average in quality. The stew tasted like it came from a can, the sauce on the wings tasted like it came from a bottle and the chef added some Indian spice to try to get a Tikka flavour and the burger was a glorified Quarter Pounder.
Very simple place its like nomal restaurant but nice food . i like it
Great atmosphere!

Very comfortable and top notch hotel.  The rooms are very clean, and the staff is always courteous and helpful.  I think it's one of the best downtown Atlanta hotels.  It's conveniently located near all major downtown locations.  The Prime Meridian Restaurant is great and the bar is better!!!

I did the online check in. Upon arrival, our room keys were not on the board. We still had to wait in line. We were then told they did not have a room ready for us, and were actually out of our room category. They had to go in the back and verify a reservation I had made months in advance, and also my online check in confirmation code. We then received a free room upgrade. The room’s view was great, however there was already makeup on the pillowcase, hair on the floor in the bathroom, and a bug crawling on the bed. Later that evening, we called room service for cheesecake and they never came. Oh, and breakfast at the hotel in the morning ran us $52. The only thing this hotel has going for it is location. Valet parking is also $45 a night.

Lovely place--especially the South Tower.  Originally we were given a room in the North Tower, which was not as spacious or new, and it didn't have much of a view. When I asked for another room, Jermaine accommodated me right away, and our new room was much better.  We had a gorgeous view of the park, plenty of room, and comfortable beds.  Most everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The food in the Prime Meridian restaurant was great, but the waiters were not always as friendly as other hotel workers.  Service there was pretty quick and appreciated as we were there for a conference.  
Checkout went very well--we needed to catch an Uber at 4:30am for a flight home, and Robert took the time to accompany us to the pickup point and even walk with us to the street for pickup.  (The street was partially blocked off due to the marathon later that day.)  All in all--a wonderful experience!

This place is gorgeous! We stayed in the South Tower, which is where the ATL location for CNN is based. The room was nice and spacious, and the balcony was awesome. They're all inside so you can sit out and relax without having to worry about the weather. I can't wait to go back!

The hotel was great! We were on the 27th floor and the view was extraordinary. The hotel is very pretty and is very close to all of the city's attractions especially the coca cola museum. The Olympic garden is right outside of the hotel which is great. The hotel rooms are nice and there service was great!

A nice place to know deeper into Dr. Kings’ life. It makes me feel like a real person is standing in front of me. But if interested in more comprehensive about the civil rights movement for the Africa Americans, Center for Civil and Human Right is definitely the place you don’t wanna miss.

The Martin Luther King Jr. National Historical Park consists of several buildings in Atlanta, Georgia, including Martin Luther King Jr.'s boyhood home and the original Ebenezer Baptist Church, the church where King was baptized and both his father Martin Luther King Sr. and he were pastors. These places, critical to the interpretation of the life of Martin Luther King Jr. and his legacy as a leader of the American Civil Rights Movement, were included in the park when it was established on October 10, 1980. Formerly a National Historic Site, the unit was redesignated as a National Historical Park on January 8, 2018 by U.S. President Donald Trump.

In total, the buildings included in the site make up 35 acres (0.14 km²). The visitor center contains a museum that chronicles the American Civil Rights Movement and the path of Martin Luther King Jr. An 1894 firehouse (Fire Station No. 6) served the Sweet Auburn community until 1991, and now contains a gift shop and an exhibit on desegregation in the Atlanta Fire Department. The "I Have a Dream" International World Peace Rose Garden, and a memorial tribute to Mohandas K. Gandhi are part of the site, as is the "International Civil Rights Walk of Fame" which commemorates some of the courageous pioneers who worked for social justice.

Fantastic exhibit detailing the life and work of Dr. King. Accessible from downtown by streetcar, bus, or my favorite: Jump bicycle (these are electric boost bikes accessible through an app. You still have to pedal the bike, but it conquers downtown's hill's with minimal effort)

All of the exhibits in the central park are free. Dr. King's home is located a bit farther down the street to the East. My group and I did not realize this and did not plan enough time to see it. You also need a ticket to see it. Make sure you plan enough time because there are a lot of exhibits to see here.

This museum brought back a lot of my childhood memories. It reminded me of the struggles of the. Freedom Riders and how social change can work for the good of people. Great videos and film clips. Relive the experiences of the Civil Rights leaders. Learn about politicians who were leaders and those that obstructed social justice. Learn what hatred and bigotry are and how they hurt us as a people. Great place.

The neighborhood is "up and coming". Parking is 10 per two hours in the adjacent lot and street parking is available.  Everything is pretty much in walking distance. Tours were sold out  at 2pm when we got in but you can walk around to see the graves and the historical church.
Great Foundation which contributes lots to those with Developmental Disabilities in metro Atlanta...

The staff who greeted us were very helpful and animated. They walked us through the process of choosing your favorite team (which is an awesome feature that lets you customize your experience somewhat). The interactive exhibits made the Hall of Fame much more interesting than I, as not a huge fan of college football, expected. It was a fun couple hours!

I only planned to spend a couple hours here but my three boys 6, 8, and 11 had such a good time we spent over 5 hrs here!  Very interactive and fun.  The best thing about the place was the employees. They really we're helpful and cheered my kids on as they did the athletic activities as well as interactive exhibits. I can't say enough about the people working here, AWESOME!

The place itself was lovely but there was one lady at the entrance that wasn't friendly. I know they deal with alot of people everyday but you still need to be nice and not be like "Get out the way take pictures later", etc. She should be a traffic guard.... But other than her the staff was great.

Being a fan of college football this place was Heaven. All the interactive activities were a lot of fun. When you go in, you sign up with your email address and the number on your lanyard they give you, you tell them your favorite team. It uses RFID technology so everytime you go buy a display that is Interactive it automatically recognizes you and your favorite team and brings up information on it. For example, the virtual face painting, it automatically brought up the right colors and logos for my school. You may also choose another school as well but it automatically brings up the one you registered with. There is also and indoor 40-yard football field where anyone can kick field goals or throw passes along with a huge big screen you can sit in bleachers and watch college football in on game day.

If you're a fan of college football, you'll love it. Pretty interactive. I wish they had more details about the dynasties and coaches, but there is still a lot here. They have a room with video boards where you can look up by about anything you want. Make the stop, you won't regret it.

Was in Atlanta for a business conference and one of our vendors sponsored an event at the Hard Rock.  The private room was great.   Good music all night.  The best part though were the snacks and desserts!  Hats off to the chef here as those were a huge hit with everyone!  Thanks to our bartenders who kept the drinks flowing and were super friendly!  Would love to have an event here if we're ever back in town!

The food is delicious. The reason why I gave this place four stars is because it took a very long time to get our food. It took about and hour to get my food. When I got the food, it was relieving, because I was hungry 😌✌🏽. I recommend this place if you have really good patience!
Shrimp fajitas were amazing! Music was fun. Very great servers and the manger was nice. Love the option to upgrade your drink for a souvenir cup

I came here with my school group and really enjoyed eating here. We arrived 30 minutes late and they still saved our 40 seats. When we had to leave early so they packed out cheesecake in a box for us. The atmosphere was not good because it was so loud but the service was fine. The pricing was a little high but besides that I enjoyed my time here and would recommend this place to others.

First off my waitress was spectacular. I mean she was so sweet and caring and wonderful and she’s the reason why I didn’t one star this review. The bartender was absolutely rude! She didn’t even greet us when we sat down not a smile not anything. The bathroom was so disgusting!!!!!!! There was tissue hanging on the seat and all over the floor. The soap dispensers we’re laying on the counter along with dirty paper towels. I had to send my salmon plate back it wasn’t seasoned and there was barbecue sauce drizzled on the salmon! I loved the waitress so much but never again.
A very good little NY style pizza joint. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. I had a great conversation with the manager. Great pizza at amazing prices.

I love the prices for what you get. The ingredients are amazing and fresh. 

The staff has always been very friendly and service speed is exactly as expected.

Rosa's is a favorite of GSU students and staff. The line is usually out the door during lunch service but the wait is no longer than 20 minutes. The pizza always tastes fresh and the delivery is pretty consistent. My friend is a regular here and has a friendly relationship with most staff. The parking around this street isn't ideal but I would recommend visiting this spot if you are in the area!

I was so incredibly excited to try this place based off of the great reviews. We were staying at a hotel right up the road, so I sent my husband out in the yucky weather to go get us some food. Unfortunately, due to the fact that the owner of the restaurant doesn't care to keep accurate hours online, my husband walked up to a closed restaurant I'm the rain. Both the hours listed on Google and the restaurant's website itself say that it is open Saturdays until 4PM. This is incorrect and caused a terrible inconvenience.
The pizza was good with an authentic style and taste but my cup had a fly on the side of it. Who know how long it was sitting there smushed?
Fantastic food, but the service is top notch! Jennifer is the absolute BEST hostess. Sean was our server and he was terrific. Very classy service
Great dining experience all around: atmosphere, service, food, and quality was perfect.

My husband and I love Atlanta Grill food and drinks 🍸 are always on point! We are regulars here especially at Luma Lounge we especially loved the service at Atlanta Grill Ms.Jennifer is a sweet lady she always make us feel so welcome!!!!!😍
Literally the smallest portions I have ever had for lunch.  Food was good but 22 bucks should give me more than 5 bites to eat.
Exceptionally good food, very quiet, and excellent service.

Had a working lunch here today and we opted to order directly from sushi menu.  We chose the salmon avocado roll, rainbow roll and the volcano roll.  Sushi can definitely be hit or miss when ordering from an establishment, because the sushi is only as good as the ingredients.  I will have to say that the sushi at Pacific Rim is definitely in my top 3 establishments for sushi. Out of the three rolls that we chose, the volcano roll was my favorite.  You can definitely taste the freshness of the ingredients.
Would highly recommend

Sushi is beautifully prepared. While we were only here for the sushi and the menu at very appetizing options. The portions are definitely larger than some of the other places we have been. Although this is more expensive than other sushi options in the area the sushi is definitely worth a little bit extra money.

A restaurant serving different southern East Asia food. Their fish dishes are good and tasty. Hong Kong style Steamed Snapper (whole fish) is what I ordered. It would taste much better if more sauce and scallions are added, and serve right out from the steamer. You might enjoy the current form, this is just my personal preference.

I love the bento boxes! From the coconut soup to the entrees the food is so authentically delicious and the ambiance is high class. I love the decor and have grown to enjoy hot green tea with my lunch. It's a popular destination among my colleagues and the service is great. You can literally go for lunch and get back to work in less than an hour.
I've been here plenty of times over and over and over. That should tell you something. Best family owned Asian cuisine in the city !!!! Foreal!

The food and service were great. So was my pineapple margarita. I swear it was made with love. The food...was phenomenal. The place is a tad bit expensive but its good if you're going out for special occasions. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because finding the parking garage was confusing and when we called to get directions the phone was constantly busy. This made us late for our reservation but they were able to accommodate us shortly after arriving. I ordered the crab cakes and it definitely was filled with tons of crab meat. My boyfriend ordered the salmon and it was amazing! We got the warm butter cake for dessert and also had the lobster bisque and lobster mac and cheese as well. Our waitress was also friendly and definitely earned her tip. I will definitely be going back. especially now that we know where to park!

Crab cake was lightly seasoned, but flavorful.  There were two spears of asparagus, and a small scoop of whipped potatoes. All of it was tasty, but I was still hungry when I finished. The meal was $19 before tax and gratuity.  I would have been more satiated by a kid's meal.  The ambience was not memorable.
If you have a empty stomach this is the best place! Food is very fresh and delicious. Great location and atmosphere. Will definitely be back

The sushi was good and relatively fresh but it’s not worth the price tag. It seems to be the only place to get decent sushi in the immediate area. Strangely, the sushi menu was very limited. There were only like 5 rolls with nothing interesting. The waiters were decent but the service could be faster. Over all, it was fine but it’s overpriced. I could easily get the same quality sushi for almost half the price elsewhere.

This food is pretty good. I’m not a big seafood person, but it all looked delicious. Their meat options are nice and their filet was good - not spectacular but it was good! Their dessert menu is one of the best that I have seen in a while. Loud atmosphere, but good food and a great wine selection.

The service was painfully slow for a mildly busy Tuesday night.  That being said, the food was amazing and worth the wait.  Quicker service (especially once we asked for the check) would have made this a 5 star review.  Definitely still worth a try.
Classy and delicious. Every time I go here, I feel like home. They make great drinks and amazing food. Had my birthday here recently. The owner was so nice he got me a free cake.

Whenever i find my self attending a Hawks game or an Atlanta united game, i take the opportunity to wine and dine at this amazing place before heading out.The food is just yummy, the atmosphere is warm and inviting and the service is exceptional. Their trout dish is my favorite and out of this world. My wife is from the South and loves the shrimp and grits dish.

I had steak. It was okay but I had only one choice. The other "real" meat on the menu was ribs which were also pretty good. Everything else on the menu was fish or sushi which wasn't at the top of my list. So if you like fish in one form or another, this may be the place for you. If not, I'd look elsewhere.  Beer selection is minimal. Our waitress was nice.

I work in the building so I went to Thrive quite often.  Service is always a bit slow but today it was horrible.  Called in order at 11:45 pm.  They said it would be ready at 12:00 pm.  I arrive at 12:05 pm.  After inquiring, food comes out at 12:20 pm.  I asked the waiter why it wasn't ready when I arrives, he stated there was an issue with my salmon.  I get to my desk and my salmon is cold.  Really... Next time I'm walking address the street to Glenn Hotel or CNN.

The place was almost empty when we first got there for our 7pm reservation but was completely full when we left. Every course was perfect. I had lamb chops for the first time an they were amazing. Would definitely recommend.

My wife and I went here for our anniversary December 2018 and it was excellent. Valet was efficient, the food was hot and tasty. Moreover, the view was breathtaking. Our server was attentive to our needs and had a special anniversary dessert made for us. My wife loved the whole event.
Fantastic service! The food was delicious and beautifully plated. The chef even sent us a complimentary dessert to celebrate our anniversary. Plus, the view is spectacular. Cannot wait to go back!
My husband & I enjoyed a magnificent birthday dinner on Friday evening. The service was great, the food was absolutely superb. The ambiance  was warm & relaxing.
Beautiful view! The best atmosphere with live jazz music in the background.

Parking is done by valet, which is less stressful and less expensive than having to find your own garage. Mid-range in price per night, but the amenities, food and drink will really cost you. Again, if you are an out of towner who doesn't want to wander too far you won't mind the value added. Rooms are decent, good for what we paid. Great service and staff. One of the better hotel experiences I have had in Atlanta.

We go to downtown Atlanta a few times a year and this was our first time at the Ellis. The person at the front desk was very friendly. The room was very nice and we were on a side street from Peachtree. There was no hotel traffic or street traffic noise which was great! The front desk sent a few texts to check on us and asked if we needed anything.  Every time we left or entered someone held the door for us.  We ordered room service breakfast and it was on time and it was good. The Ellis is still close to all the things we like to do downtown. The map and driving instructions on Expedia were wrong and showed the corner of Baker and Peachtree. After talking to my wife we couldn't think of anything we were disappointed with  as far as the hotel itself so we are giving the Ellis 5 stars. We would stay there again!

Boutique hotel in the heart of the city.  Great bar and patio, along with a second floor balcony to enjoy the city views.

Recently purchased by Marriott I am curious to see what changes are made as they will only enhance the already great qualities of the hotel.  

Location of the hotel is perfect, pretty much stands alone on the corner and the staff all around was fantastic.  

The fitness center is a little small but then again, it is a downtown boutique hotel - the appeal is in the building, design, and location.
Nice, boutique hotel with friendly hosts. They have a nice breakfast area that was perfect before our day out. Rooms were nice and clean. We would stay here again!

Restaurant was nice but the BAR was where it’s at! Had an amazing time chatting and laughing with the bartender Sequoia! Her customer service was outstanding! And drinks were to die for. The other staff were friendly for the most part. One worker seemed to walk around with a snare and just unwelcoming look. Bad day perhaps.

Very comfortable and top notch hotel.  The rooms are very clean, and the staff is always courteous and helpful.  I think it's one of the best downtown Atlanta hotels.  It's conveniently located near all major downtown locations.  The Prime Meridian Restaurant is great and the bar is better!!!

I did the online check in. Upon arrival, our room keys were not on the board. We still had to wait in line. We were then told they did not have a room ready for us, and were actually out of our room category. They had to go in the back and verify a reservation I had made months in advance, and also my online check in confirmation code. We then received a free room upgrade. The room’s view was great, however there was already makeup on the pillowcase, hair on the floor in the bathroom, and a bug crawling on the bed. Later that evening, we called room service for cheesecake and they never came. Oh, and breakfast at the hotel in the morning ran us $52. The only thing this hotel has going for it is location. Valet parking is also $45 a night.

Lovely place--especially the South Tower.  Originally we were given a room in the North Tower, which was not as spacious or new, and it didn't have much of a view. When I asked for another room, Jermaine accommodated me right away, and our new room was much better.  We had a gorgeous view of the park, plenty of room, and comfortable beds.  Most everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The food in the Prime Meridian restaurant was great, but the waiters were not always as friendly as other hotel workers.  Service there was pretty quick and appreciated as we were there for a conference.  
Checkout went very well--we needed to catch an Uber at 4:30am for a flight home, and Robert took the time to accompany us to the pickup point and even walk with us to the street for pickup.  (The street was partially blocked off due to the marathon later that day.)  All in all--a wonderful experience!

This place is gorgeous! We stayed in the South Tower, which is where the ATL location for CNN is based. The room was nice and spacious, and the balcony was awesome. They're all inside so you can sit out and relax without having to worry about the weather. I can't wait to go back!

The hotel was great! We were on the 27th floor and the view was extraordinary. The hotel is very pretty and is very close to all of the city's attractions especially the coca cola museum. The Olympic garden is right outside of the hotel which is great. The hotel rooms are nice and there service was great!

Parking is done by valet, which is less stressful and less expensive than having to find your own garage. Mid-range in price per night, but the amenities, food and drink will really cost you. Again, if you are an out of towner who doesn't want to wander too far you won't mind the value added. Rooms are decent, good for what we paid. Great service and staff. One of the better hotel experiences I have had in Atlanta.

We go to downtown Atlanta a few times a year and this was our first time at the Ellis. The person at the front desk was very friendly. The room was very nice and we were on a side street from Peachtree. There was no hotel traffic or street traffic noise which was great! The front desk sent a few texts to check on us and asked if we needed anything.  Every time we left or entered someone held the door for us.  We ordered room service breakfast and it was on time and it was good. The Ellis is still close to all the things we like to do downtown. The map and driving instructions on Expedia were wrong and showed the corner of Baker and Peachtree. After talking to my wife we couldn't think of anything we were disappointed with  as far as the hotel itself so we are giving the Ellis 5 stars. We would stay there again!

Boutique hotel in the heart of the city.  Great bar and patio, along with a second floor balcony to enjoy the city views.

Recently purchased by Marriott I am curious to see what changes are made as they will only enhance the already great qualities of the hotel.  

Location of the hotel is perfect, pretty much stands alone on the corner and the staff all around was fantastic.  

The fitness center is a little small but then again, it is a downtown boutique hotel - the appeal is in the building, design, and location.
Nice, boutique hotel with friendly hosts. They have a nice breakfast area that was perfect before our day out. Rooms were nice and clean. We would stay here again!

Restaurant was nice but the BAR was where it’s at! Had an amazing time chatting and laughing with the bartender Sequoia! Her customer service was outstanding! And drinks were to die for. The other staff were friendly for the most part. One worker seemed to walk around with a snare and just unwelcoming look. Bad day perhaps.

Very comfortable and top notch hotel.  The rooms are very clean, and the staff is always courteous and helpful.  I think it's one of the best downtown Atlanta hotels.  It's conveniently located near all major downtown locations.  The Prime Meridian Restaurant is great and the bar is better!!!

I did the online check in. Upon arrival, our room keys were not on the board. We still had to wait in line. We were then told they did not have a room ready for us, and were actually out of our room category. They had to go in the back and verify a reservation I had made months in advance, and also my online check in confirmation code. We then received a free room upgrade. The room’s view was great, however there was already makeup on the pillowcase, hair on the floor in the bathroom, and a bug crawling on the bed. Later that evening, we called room service for cheesecake and they never came. Oh, and breakfast at the hotel in the morning ran us $52. The only thing this hotel has going for it is location. Valet parking is also $45 a night.

Lovely place--especially the South Tower.  Originally we were given a room in the North Tower, which was not as spacious or new, and it didn't have much of a view. When I asked for another room, Jermaine accommodated me right away, and our new room was much better.  We had a gorgeous view of the park, plenty of room, and comfortable beds.  Most everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The food in the Prime Meridian restaurant was great, but the waiters were not always as friendly as other hotel workers.  Service there was pretty quick and appreciated as we were there for a conference.  
Checkout went very well--we needed to catch an Uber at 4:30am for a flight home, and Robert took the time to accompany us to the pickup point and even walk with us to the street for pickup.  (The street was partially blocked off due to the marathon later that day.)  All in all--a wonderful experience!

This place is gorgeous! We stayed in the South Tower, which is where the ATL location for CNN is based. The room was nice and spacious, and the balcony was awesome. They're all inside so you can sit out and relax without having to worry about the weather. I can't wait to go back!

The hotel was great! We were on the 27th floor and the view was extraordinary. The hotel is very pretty and is very close to all of the city's attractions especially the coca cola museum. The Olympic garden is right outside of the hotel which is great. The hotel rooms are nice and there service was great!

I cannot say enough great things about Hotel Clermont.  I stayed there for 2 nights in the Ruby Suite, as a part of a {work}cation event I hosted for Atlanta entrepreneurs.  It truly felt like home.  The staff were so warm and friendly, and even the guests were really fun!  I can't wait to stay again.

Accidentally booked a bunk bed room on Valentine's Day and it was the best thing ever. A bunch of friends came over from out of town and they got to experience the famous Clermont Lounge in addition to a wholesome old school camp style sleepover. Staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating at the desk, bar, and restaurant. Rooms were so cute! Like a Wes Anderson wet dream. I live here and I already know I'll constantly be looking for excuses to stay again and again.

We initially visited the rooftop bar. It was definitely a causal and enjoyable space and experience. We had reservations for Tiny Lou's and reason for visit. We really enjoyed the appetizers. The entrees were just ok. The wine was good and reasonable. We'll definitely go back. The service and ambiance were great.

A fantastic location and almost exceptional visit. Had a little bump with customer service but it recovered enough to move the rating to 4. I do worry that this now cute boutique hotel that is 4 months old will not age well. For now though make the visit it's cheeky and will create a cool experience.

Great staff and great drinks. There is valet, but just buy a few drinks and it gets validated.
Tiny Lou's is on the bottom floor. Great food

Clermont lounge on the other side. Must go

Roof top bar is perfect to see the skyline

The Fox Theatre is almost legendary for how stunning it is, and it simply cannot be put into words how great this place is to visit. For adults, they offer some alcoholic beverages, but for the children they have popcorn and candy and stuff like that. The views are great from every seat, and the actors they put on are the best in the south. Les Miserables was amazing to witness, and with the great views, nice staff, and plenty of eating options, it's going to be hard to pass in the south. Absolutely recommend to anyone who wants a more formal night on the town with their family, friend, or lover.

The Fox is one of Atlanta's great dames. It's a beautiful palace. Architecturally stunning Moorish style design. Great place to see Broadway shows and attend events in the grand Egyptian ballroom.  But had a blast seeing my girl Mariah Carey! The BEST!

I love the Fox. It is a great music venue. It’s hard to believe that this historic Arabian motif building was almost torn down. The venue has approximately 4,600 seats all with unobstructed views. We just saw Trevor Noah, and we have see other musicals and concerts.
If you’re visiting Atlanta it’s one of the “must see” places here for the history and a great experience. It is a pricey for drinks and refreshments but that’s expected.One of my favorite places in Atlanta.

The beautiful Fox Theater is a landmark  in Atlanta. Wonderfully restored many years ago. I recently saw Les Miserables and sat in the orchestra section toward the back. No problem seeing the stage and all of the actors. The sound was clean and loud enough to be easily heard. If you have never been, please go. The wonderful blue star lit sky inside the theatre is amazing. The only negative is the traffic and parking. Very congested.  Took almost 1 hour to just get out of the parking garage.

This establishment is one of my all time favorite places to be. It definitely is my happy place. I have been to a total of 6 Broadway Productions and they were all so different in style and The Fox theater housed them so well. Very happy to have this Majestic theater in Atlanta.

Beautiful little pearl of architecture show. You will find like 10 different huge programs. Usually ONG building complex in the most diverse climate, necessities and budget. Give it a chance. You will be surprised! Very interesting shop there too. The people is super nice and ready to help you.
While small, it was a really nice museum.  I enjoyed the focus on a single exhibit that rotates regularly.  Highly recommend MODA.
Lots of coffee makers and you get some coffee too. Good thing to check out if you've seen the High like ten times already though the big ole art room never gets old.
Does one exhibit at a time, but very well planned. Great place to spend 30-45 minutes. Offers a lot of fun classes that you can sign up for

Visited on a 'Free Family' Sunday and am glad we did as I was underwhelmed by the exhibit. Couched as an engineering and music exhibit, there were only 3 interactive displays that all of the people (mainly kids) crowded around in 3 medium-sized rooms on a single floor. I'm not sure if there's a 2nd floor and/or if it has exhibits during a regular viewing day (admission fee).

On the bright side, my 8-yr was amazed at the typewriter, but so were all the other kids and there wasn't any time limits imposed on playing with them.

If you took away the add-on engineering exhibits, you could probably walk around, read every word on the walls and see the handful of building models in under an hour. All in all, I'd say this is really a good place if you're either in the industry or really into design/architecture, and/or if you'd like to get a book on the subject.

This museum had an amazing amounts of different contemporary styles and media. The staff were really friendly and the place had a good atmosphere. The only problem is that the stairs (while pretty) and very hard to walk up/down. Finding the back stairs would make things easier for the elderly and disabled audience.
Beautiful space hidden off of Peachtree Road. Came here during the Atlanta Preservation Center's Phoenix Flies and really enjoyed the docent tour! All Georgia artwork.
We go there often. This is another good hidden place in Atlanta where not many people know about.
Great visit to the museum with the family.  I love contemporary art.
It was very nice!... The art there was very lovely... And they also have a professional photographer...

I confess that I have neither read the book nor seen the film, but I found this museum very interesting. The guide (also called Margaret) was very knowledgeable and made me want to find out more about this tiny but talented lady.

There is a room which shows the 1988 documentary about the making of 'Gone with the Wind' which I found fascinating, but beware: it is two hours long!

Although I was only able to view this location from the gate, it was cool to see. The historical value of places like this is undervalued (in my opinion). I was glad to have found it within walking distance of the restaurant I was at.

This is the story of Margaret Mitchell, the author of Gone With The Wind and the making of the movie. This is an awesome story and a must see if you are interested in history. I promise it will not be a waste of your time!
Good experience. Apt had period furniture & the staff was very knowledgeable. I asked a few questions; all were answered to my satisfaction. Be sure to attend tour through home w guide.
Very nice tour back in times. Not a big museum, but if you like GWTW, it's a must see.

What an amazing experience. Not much else to say other than this is a true treasure and will no doubt bring back plenty of memories for many while also preserving them for another generation. The Jim Henson side of the museum, in particular, is incredible. The amount of time they have spent to tell his true story and build exhibits that are as true to original as possible is incredible. This is a great place to spend a couple of hours and well worth the price of entry!

Very enjoyable. We’d never been to a place like this, unique museum that you don’t typically find 
Our kids enjoyed the family series show (The Joshua Show) and creating a puppet after. Took about 1/2hr to 45 minutes to go through the exhibits after so it was a good 1/2 day activity. The staff was very nice and helpful.

The show here has always been phenomenal. However, at times, the help and the museum were nothing to write home about.  Now the museum is home to the Muppets.  It is as cool or better than the show itself.  Any Muppet fan will enjoy seeing how they are made, old original puppets and even taking pictures on a mock set.  Can't wait to go back!

O M GOSH !!! This place is GREAT!!! I came in from Nashville for the meet and greet with Joel from Mystery Science 3000. The center was full of really nice employees, many who went out of their to make the event enjoyable for everyone. I am very grateful to the people that took the pictures mine was fuzzy and they were nice enough to let me get another one. The food they served was so much more then one would think.. We had salmon, roast beef, and many other great items. The cash bar was a great price too. Thank you for such a great experience!!! Now I want to be a friend and help with your next projects

We came for the Dark Crystal exhibit and enjoyed every exhibit they had. It was great fun to see Sesame Street puppets in person and to learn about how they were made and used. Great place for both children and adults; there is something for everyone here.

Fun with a lot of choices. The staff is attentive and there is a deal on the menu most days. There are good deals all around with their VIP program which is free and easy to joint. The hummus is insanely good and big enough for one person or to be shared by many. Their tap and bottle selection is large and varied. Needless to say expect desserts to be huge. It gets busy during weekends but I always get a table in less than 20 minutes and it’s a great opportunity to hang out by the bar. $$
The drinks are amazing and very well priced.. the service is incredible and it's within walking distance of the park. The music was pretty great too!

Arrived but waited 15 minutes for valet parking. Seated and waited for server for an hour before making the hostess aware that we had not seen our server. 
Group that arrived after me served with drinks within 10 minutes. 
Poor service compared to my first visit. Not a happy customer.
Absolutely love the drink menu!!!  Servers and bartenders are pretty awesome too! I recommend Steven as your bartender!!
Great on customer service!! I’ve been coming here for years and always a great time... a tad slow on food late night but they always make up for it with the friendly service

This is nice American dinner. It offers your typical comfort food, served fast and with typical Southerner friendliness. Portions are good, prices are fair and the coffee is always flowing. Breakfast on weekends is very busy, so you may have to wait to get seated. The staff are very welcoming and friendly. Definitively give this place a try if you are in this neighborhood.

Loved the food here! I ordered the chicken tenders with a Belgian Waffle. Sooo good! Very small establishment, therefore, we had to stand in line outside and wait for tables to become available. Waitress was awesome and did not have to wait long for our orders. Will definitely come back and will recommend to family and friends!!

Great Diner. Plenty of good options to try. Its def a hidden gem of midtown. If you are stopping through Atlanta its a place where you should eat. It gets very packed ,but food is good and service is prompt. They help keep it moving so they can accommodate everyone without any party feeling rushed
Used to love the country ham here. Sadly now it's way too salty and tough as leather. However, there are so many good choices I can probably get over it.
Great piece of history. If you haven't been you should definitely check it out. The waitresses are no nonsense but efficient and polite.

Great place to eat absolutely great staff plus the cheese sauce is addictive. This ia hands down my favorite spot to eat, clean, fast and tasty with superior service. The mango lemonade is great with the tacos plus the salsa is very good. Definitely a place to take a date,friend or to just go by yourself. 1071 Piedmont is the best Willy's I've been to.
Good food. Good times. Awesome location. Meet friends at the park and then grab a bite !! Great drinks available. Dog friendly outside as well.
We come everytime we are in the city.  Great margaritas and lemonade.  Love their vegan bowl options!

I had a wonderful experience at Willys on Piedmont, very impressed by the service. I met Mr Adam, one of the director's, an amazing guy, with a heart for customers, I wish i could give them 20 stars... I reccomend Willys on Piedmont to the entire state of Ga. and anyone that comes to visit.
Such a good place to eat and convenient location in not such a convenient neighborhood!

Actually enjoy everything about this place. Wish it was in more locations nationally. Great service but floor was wet and watched a lady fall. Otherwise perfect. Excellent beer selection and the wings were also above grade. Try them if it's your first time.

I went to this Taco Mac for my birthday. It was the biggest mistake of the weekend. The bartenders were slow. We sat and waited I know at least ten minutes before anyone would acknowledge us. We got our beers. One of the two drinks were incorrect. Whatever, it was beer. Ordered a second round and both drinks were wrong. It took another ten minutes after that to get the check despite.  At this point, I do not ever want to step foot in another Taco Mac. My money will be spent elsewhere and I encourage anyone that actually knows their beer to stay away as well.   And to add, the tables around us weren't bussed the entire time we were there.
I love Taco Mac’s wings. They are absolutely the best wings. Get the slow burn and blue cheese dressing. You can also get all drums for a small charge.
My time here was enjoyable. Our server Jeanette was very attentive and pleasant. And not to mention the drinks were good too.

Amirah was the best server! She was attentive and intuitive. I would definitely request her when I return. I pick my favorites off the menu and I wasn't disappointed. My drinks were mixed well and had a nice pour

This is a hole-in-the-wall restaurant. Some foods are hit or miss. But, definitely get the Chicken Lasagna!  Comes with a side Salad & Garlic Bread. 

Apparently, this restaurant is also under the ownership of Fellini's Pizza chain as well. Hence, the scrumptious Lasagna! 

Aside from lasagna, the Turkey Meatloaf & Jerk Chicken are the Top Picks for any combo meal! I usually get the Meat + 3 sides for the best deal. Sides includes Broccoli Casserole, Corn on the Cobb,  Green Beans, Collard Greens, Mac & Cheese. 

All combo meals come with a corn bread. Unfortunately, the corn bread is tasteless & dry. But, goes well with the marinara sauce if you have some from your lasagna! Lol...

I really enjoyed my visit here. Nice, clean atmosphere. The food was good. The jerk chicken was seasoned, juicy and just delicious, macaroni delicious and cheesy, broccoli casserole delish. However, the collards could have been cooked a bit more with more seasoning and corn bread was cold but still good. The booth we sat in need to be bolted down because it tips. Other than that good outing and I will return.

Fun eclectic place that has comfort food. The prices are reasonable and the food is great, it’s a major upgrade from somewhere like Piccadilly. I always come here and get the jerk chicken, it’s just like my grandmother used to make and she’s from the islands.

Love this spot. I went last Saturday for lunch and it was so good that I took my husband back yesterday for his 1st time. I had the create your own pasta with fetucine spinach pasta, Alfredo sauce, chicken, mushrooms and broccoli.  My husband had jerk chicken, macaroni, collard greens and broccoli casserole. He loved his food.

I’ve been coming here for about 5 years! This place is awesome! John is one kool dude! He always makes my experience enjoyable! ❤️ They make their veggies vegetarian friendly and also have a pasta bar!! 😄😍

In from out of town for a conference, and got a recommendation for southern comfort good. Mary Max's didn't disappoint! The fried chicken was juicy and tender, collard greens were cooked well, and the cheesy grits were a great side. Added in a mint julep, and finished with the bread pudding (that wine sauce though). Very reasonable for the money, and food came incredibly quick, and service was friendly and helpful. Worth checking out!

This place was awesome! My first time dining in Atlanta will be remembered for sure. The appetizers, drinks, and entrees all hit southern comfort on the head. I couldn't have been more impressed with the rack of ribs, and the mac'n'cheese was out of this world. It seemed to be a popular location, so you may have a wait time ahead of you on a night or weekend. Though, my party of 6 was told there was an hour wait, we were still seated less than 20 minutes from then.

Good ambience. Food was yummy. Fresh lemonade was too sweet, but I think that’s normal in the south :) had the chicken with pepper sauce, grits and fried green tomatoes. Filling and delicious. The chicken was a little dry but the sauce made it less so. I enjoyed my meal very much. 
I was eating alone so was able to sit at bar and didn’t have to wait at all! Bonus, because there is a long line of people waiting. :)

I planned a luncheon here and it went so well! Guests were able to choose their own entrees while the sides and breads were served family style.  Mo, our server, was exceptional! He took pride in his work and was also a history buff. He gave us detailed information not only about the 7 rooms in Mary Mac's, but also many tales about Atlanta history. My guests raved about the food, the service, and the event. Great job, Mary Mac's! You made me look great for my work event.

Busy place with down to Earth staff. Trendy business with trendy clientele. Parking is somewhat limited, but doable. Plan ahead as there can be a wait or a line during the busiest hours. Food is considered tasty, but inconsistent at times. The owners are very proud of their business and it shows in the pricing, so be prepared to crack open your wallet, and everything has a cost. Nothing is free nor complimentary here.

It's always crowded, but for good reason. The food is marvelous, and the atmosphere is distinctly unique. Everything is fresh/made from scratch, and the flavor combinations are consistently marvelous. Do be warned that the wait is always long, as in one hour or more, especially for groups. I went alone and managed to get a seat in 20 minutes, but your experience may vary. I always recommend the Flying Biscuit Cafe.

Excellent customer service and good food.
The flavors that they serve are exquisitely amazing and delicious. 
Very happy with their service. 
Everybody at this place is so cheerful and lively.
I absolutely love this happy vibe place.

A really enjoyable place. Everyone was really nice. I got the vegan tofu scramble and it was delicious and full of flavor. I only suggest if they are going to serve a vegan meal not to add a biscuit that is made with dairy to the meal. Overall a great experience.

The Flying Biscuit had delicious food and good coffee. The grits and biscuits were especially exquisite. The server and host were really friendly and we had a great conversation through my meal. I would highly recommend this place to anyone that would like a taste of Atlanta hospitality!

Quaint cafe with plenty of seating for one or two persons (also has seating for larger parties). The staff was very attentive and prompt. My food came out quickly and was delicious. Portion sizes are great for the price. Would definitely recommend stopping by and grabbing the Biscuit Chicken Pot Pie!

The atmosphere of this place is unbeatable. It's a neat neighborhood Midtown tavern and I always take my parents when they come into town. The burners and fire pit outside on the patio are ultra cozy during the winter months. Their beer selection is always fantastic. One of my favorites was the one off beer they served by Brooklyn Brewery  when they came into town in 2018. Other than that, they always have great selections and rotations. The food is amazing as well. The Shepherd's pie is to die for. So are their burgers. Stop by for one of their themed nights as well.

One of the greatest patios in Atlanta. Awesome place to hangout with great food, good service, beer and wine list. 

Better than average offerings of snacks, sandwiches and burgers. Love the Pub Fries and always have to have the Cypress Philly.
Fun date night location. Food is great. Want to go back for the bacon-mac. Parking is on the road so plan accordingly. I showed up later in the evening and street parking was free.

Best casual bar in Atlanta with phenomenal food. It is hard for me to just call this a bar since their food is better than a lot of the high end restaurants in Atlanta. This place has always meant a lot to me especially when I used to be in the service industry. They would always welcome us and treat us like friends and they offer $3 ipas always (house beer). When it's cold outside the fire pit is amazing. it is not necessarily a place to go watch sports but they have the TVs for that if that's your thing. If you are welcoming someone to Atlanta or having a first date or just want to hang out with friends this is your go-to bar. I really appreciate all the memories and of course I will be back. I have met a lot of good friends here and this is one of my favorite spots in the city.

Went here one late weekend and the environment was awesome. Great people laid back and great food. Although there choices past midnight are limited it was great. Also they have many selections of beer Ale and mix drinks.

I've eaten at Bab's a few times and if you are looking for a local place with a local feel come here. The food is great and the atmosphere is cozy. Cozy in terms of decor and size. There are about 10 or so tables inside and a few more outside. The menu changes often however every dish is well thought out and delivers the home cooked feel that is missing with some other restaurants.

Stumbled on to this little gem. Neat little place with exceptional service and food. Right when we walked through the door we were made to feel right at home. Lots of breakfast specials each one sounding better than the last. Food was delicious. Seriously considering going back again tomorrow.

Babs might be short on table count but it is long on charm! There's a little lounge area, where the hostess offers you a drink while you're waiting on your table. I recommend the blood Orange mimosa. Once we were seated, the menu, though short, had delicious, local gourmet options for a variety of diet options (vegan, too!). I loved the blueberry French toast special, but the Amore on the menu was amazingly light and fluffy, too. Oh, and don't skip a slice of the homemade German chocolate cake, either. It is to DIE for!

It was our first time at Babs and it certainly won’t be the last! We came on a Sunday during brunch. First, they are one of the few restaurants that takes reservations on the weekends during brunch time so that’s a major plus! They have a variety of options for the carnivore or vegetarian! We tried the butternut squash lasagna with goat cheese. It was delicious! Not too sweet or rich and just the right amount. Our server was fantastic and provided great recommendations. The food came out quickly and everything was fresh. I loved that it was an eclectic group of staff, as well as patrons. If you want a good feel for how Atlanta embraces diversity through food and people, come here!!!

Today was my first experience at Babs and I was so happy we chose this spot. As soon as we walked in it was such a warm welcome feeling. Their staff was outstanding, super friendly, and I loved how small/intimate it was. We both ordered the blueberry French toast. It exceed my expectations! We will definitely be back!

Great, casual atmosphere. Simple to read menu. Lunch specials are great and affordable. I recommend it for a quick lunch or even dinner with friends and family. The owner and staff are wonderful people and very accommodating! The spicy fried rice with pork is one of my favorites!!

*Written by a First grade student for a writing assignment* "I went to Nan.  I went with my dad and my mom. It was really fancy. The waitress was really nice, she had a sweet voice and she came to us whenever she could.  It was good! We were eating steak. It was really good. And we had lemon cake and chocolate mousse cake. This was a good place for grown ups, mainly. I was the only kid there."  -Z.K.-

A lovely experience all around.  The ambiance was quiet, yet lively, and the restaurant was well lit without being overbearing.  The wait staff was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and helpful in making selections that met our personal preferences.  The food we ordered was amazing:  beautifully seasoned, cooked and presented.  The only small hiccup is that two of the four entrees came out significantly earlier than the remaining two.  I will definitely be returning.

For our anniversary we decided to try this restaurant. One of the best experience and food we had. Food was extremely good and service was spot on. All the dishes we ordered came in time and hot. We really enjoyed the taste. They gave a surprise desert for our anniversary. All the staff was very kind and attentive.  Thumbs up

Loved this place! Harry is the best bartender, ever! Impeccable service and delightful personality. When you walk in, you are greeted with a traditional bow and a smile. Very attentive service from a Diamond Award winning establishment! Everything was delicious, right down to the Thai tea and dessert!

Solid brunch. Bloody Mary was pretty standard. Pimento jar with bacon marmalade and toast was out favorite app, the morning bun was tasty too. I had the steak and eggs with roasted root vegetables. Tasty but not mind-blowing. My husband had the sourdough pancakes with ricotta and apple which were very tasty. Loved the vibes on the patio. We might go back of we're in the area.

We so enjoyed this little upscale restaurant.  It is a little unnoticeable but a really good find.  Sitting at Peachtree and 10th, it's a convenient place to grab a nice meal.  Service was top notch. It is a little on the pricey side and minimal meal option, but all was prepared deliciously. Definitely would recommend!

Great experience here.  The farm egg farro was incredibly savory and rich-- one of my favorite dishes I had in 2018.  Service and atmosphere was excellent.  Not a cheap place but some of their dishes are amazing.

Wow!  We had a corporate event here and it was an excellent venue!!  The food was excellent!  I still can't get over how good the Farm Egg (Or some name like that) was!  It had this deep-fried rice that was AMAZING.  Great texture and taste.  Then the mushrooms, and other items mix together for a dish I could just keep eating!
Also the restaurant is very nice casual.  I love the outdoor area!

I really appreciated this cafe, the food is incredible, as well as the restrooms were tidy. It was a little cool inside, really was not the most enjoyable. The food serve is good too. I will absolutely think about returning again if I have the opportunity. Me as well as my good friend purchased the salad as well as we were not let down. My one suggestion is to maintain the chilly outside. See you all again.!
Pretty good multi-course meal for $40 here

Reallr, really, really bad. Terrible combination of flavors and ingredients. In a city like Atlanta, a restaurant like this shouldn't have lasted even a day. Even Peoria, IL has a better "spice market" than this joint. Save your $$ for the gazillion better options in ATL.

Having read the reviews here, and having dined at the original in NYC, I have to say that the variability of this branch of Chef Vongerichten's empire is its downfall. I dined here once and thought, "well anyone can have an off night", so I dined here again the next night and the experience on the front side improved, but the food was, to put it tactfully and gently, awful! They can't seem to put together a consistent service or kitchen staff. The food on my first time here this year (I have been here three times in the last year) was bland, poorly prepared, and the service was marked by an apparent lack of training and experience. Now, I realize this is Atlanta and not New York, and that good, professional help is scarce, but c'mon folks--this is supposed to be a high end place (the prices sure trend that way!). Have you ever heard of training and supervision of staff? You can do lots, lots better! When a customer shows up at the entrance with no one around, is noticed by several staff including the bartender, but still no one comes, that is a sign that the management of this restaurant either is unmotivated or clueless. Either way, much improvement is needed. Nonetheless, because I know and respect Chef Vongerichten's restaurants, and I was staying in the hotel, I decided to give it another shot. This time, I was greeted promptly, and the waitress who served me appeared professional, in addition to friendly. However, this time, the food was, to put it tactfully and diplomatically,  absolutely awful. Other than the appetizers and main course arriving together, which was something that should never happen--even in a restaurant that says it serves "family style" (by which I understand that the dishes are served to the table, not each individual diner), the food was simply bad. I had the chicken satay which was like eating pieces of rubber. I ate it because I was hungry, not having eaten since that morning. I had ordered sticky coconut rice wrapped in a banana leaf as a side, along with grilled halibut. Well, the sticky rice was so sticky I had to cut it with a knife to get a mouthful. The halibut was so overdone and dry that it, too, was inedible. I asked the waitress who was in the kitchen and she said the head chef (omigod! if this is what the top guy allows out his kitchen door to customers then this restaurant is in big, big trouble!). I communicated my issues to her and in a minute or so the manager appeared. I reviewed the problems with him and he was apologetic, but it remains to be seen whether this restaurant will ever rise much above the level (or to the level given, its current starting point) of Bonefish Grill or Cheesecake Factory, while charging prices far above those establishments. Thankfully, I did not have to pay for this meal, but I would have gladly paid for a meal that even came close to expectations of a restaurant in this restaurant group.
One last thing-I hate writing bad reviews. A bad review means that I had a bad experience in a place and at a time when the experience should be nothing but pleasant. Anyone who reads my reviews on TripAdvisor knows that I tend to be glowing in my praise when a restaurant provides a good experience. I want to appreciate, and can, any type of dining experience. I don't expect the local pit barbecue to be Per se, but I do expect any restaurant running under the banner of a fabulous chef like Jean Georges Vongerichten to be at least adequate. So, to write a review like this is both unusual and dismaying for me. I do hope, if I am at Spice Market Atlanta next year, that I will be able to retract this review and report a wonderful experience from service to food. I hope so.
trendy, hip, great food and service to matchy. when dining in the heart of midtown, who could ask for anything more.
small plates, over-priced, ok food

You'd be hard pressed to find better food in Atlanta.  Farm to table fresh, inventive creations from the chef, service polished to near perfection, and a lovely setting make it an excellent destination.   Yet, there's something that feels formulaic--the spontaneity and uniqueness of dining here is lessened from the Bacchanalia of old.  Still, it's very worthwhile for that special occasion or for any evening when you're okay to drop a few pennies.

Went to Bacchanalia a few years ago with my wife and it was really good, but we felt like it feel a little short of all the hype. Fast forward to this month, we went again to try out their new home on the Westside, and we were blown away. I sincerely could not have asked for a better experience or food. The service was impeccable. The food was perfectly portioned and prepared. I had a hard time choosing what to order because everything on the menu, within each course, sounded so good. I'll be back very soon and highly recommend Bacchanalia. It was once the restaurant in Atlanta that received top honors every year, and if they haven't regained that title, they certainly deserve to.

Amazing service and attention to detail. The staff was incredibly considerate and made every aspect of the evening enjoyable. Unquestionably the food was amazing and the atmosphere was perfect. I couldn't recommend a restaurant more.

Bacchanalia was very professional and tasty, but lacked a few things necessary for me to rate 5 stars at this price point. The location is great and avoids local road traffic in the area. I also really appreciated the self-parking. The dining room wasn't too loud and had a neat feeling, but there were a few quirks (e.g. the tables that lock you in to the bench seats and lights dimmed every time the bar dishwasher turned on). All the food was very tasty, but didn't quite blow our minds the way I would expect for a $250+ dinner. The only true disappointment was the beer list. I ordered the best IPA on tap (Wicked Weed Freak of Nature), but was informed it had already tapped out...at 6:15pm. There wasn't anything else comparable to replace it.  I wish restaurants (especially at this level) would update their beer list to reflect what is actually available.

The service was top-notch, but lacked warmth. We had everything we needed (and never thought about water), but there was no personal connection. Maybe that's their operating model?

Overall, we felt like One Midtown Kitchen (now closed) and Local Three offer more creative/impressive dishes and friendlier service at a better price point compared to Bacchanalia.

Absolutely amazing restaurant! The staff is responsive and professional and my glass was never empty. The food was fabulous and we’ll portioned. I recommend business casual attire with a jacket no tie.

We love Manuel's Tavern. So iconic and such amazing history. A great watering hole with good food and service. Can't go wrong here. Ordered the club sandwich. Excellent! The steak fries were a bit cold and seemed quite old,  but I'm giving them a pass. They took great care of us today.
We had the gyro's w/ sweet potato tater tots. It was all very good. They also have a Kobe beef burger. The beer selection is good, kind staff and very cool welcoming atmosphere. Highly recommend.

Last week I attended a book event to meet an author and an entrepreneur.  Parking was available across the street from the restaurant. Upon arrival there was no signage as to where to go but I figured it out. Just before the event started I ordered a small bite because Because I ate earlier.  

My order of black beans and guacamole came out quickly and tasted fresh and delicious. From my review of the menu they have a variety of offerings for different diets.  

Staff were professional and friendly enough. 

I enjoyed my time there.
Great place overall. Very good for casual time with friends. Good for small event gatherings in The Nest. I've seen people host board game and tabletop have events here.

If they have the chicken pot pie... do it! Its loaded with lists of chicken and the "pie" on top can be lifted off so you can get the filling with just the right amount of crust. It was delicious, I hope it stays!!!!

West Egg Cafe is always delicious. Be prepared to wait 30min-1hr (average) for a table. It's always worth the wait. The cinnamon rolls, shrimp and grits, and banana nut bread french toast are fantastic! 
Drinks are also made top notch! 
I only wish they would consider using the NoWait app.

reviews.author_name: マーチングリーウェスリー
reviews.text:
Phenomenal tasting food. I had the smoked salmon avocado toast. It was a beautiful blend of flavors. Thinly sliced salmon that melts in your mouth. A light marinade that assaults your taste buds. All on top of perfectly ripe sliced avocado and toasted rye. 

My only complaint was the hint of sweat and body order that permeated throughout the restaurant. I became numb to it after a few minutes though. Overall wonderful a  experience.

Never disappointed. Wonderful service, wonderful food. They do give large portions, so beware. The coffee drinks are amazing! You can order while you wait. Go before 10 AM so you don't have to wait for more than 15-20 minutes.

Good atmosphere in a better part of town. The sour cream pancakes are what this place is known for. The “small stack” is very generous, although a little on the tasteless side if I’m to be completely honest. Still, the hospitality and the cafe itself is 4 stars because it’s one of the nicer cafes in Georgia. Come here for breakfast on the weekday when there are zero queues at 9-10am!

Wonderful breakfast. Staff is extremely accommodating and quick with service. I was in a rush and several people made sure I could get in and out. They were so busy and were on top of their service with me and typically people aren't so attentive when someone is in a hurry and they've got a full house. This has been the best service I have received when a restaurant is completely full. And wonderful food!!
